info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 03 at 8:14PM EDT until June 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Catawba County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Eastern Lincoln County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southern Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 813 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles south of Statesville, or near Troutman, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Statesville, Maiden, Westport, Troutman, Lake Norman, Lake Norman State Park, Denver, Sherrills Ford, Bandys and Terrell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Norman, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
